ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Discussions about a variety of topics relating to the practice of science and neuroscience in particular.
I would summarize it by saying that this course consists of an intersting discussion-style format with new faculty each week regarding topics that are of ethical concerns in the sciences

You discuss "ethical" issues and write a short paper every week, then do a final project on something totally random. It's a required course so it doesn't really matter whether or not I recommend it. If I had a choice I would rather take a different course that actually taught me something. I can't complain too much because it was pretty easy.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Conducting science requires an appreciation of the many non-scientific issues that arise in an academic career. This course helped me think about and understand these issues more fully.
I don't think it did much other than reiterate things I already knew.
